title: 3 Simple Ways to Make Your Venmo Account More Private

steps.title: Open the Venmo app.
steps.content: Open the Venmo app. This looks like a white V with a blue background.

steps.title: Tap your profile picture.
steps.content: Tap your profile picture. This will be at the bottom-right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap the cog icon.
steps.content: Tap the cog icon. You can find this in the top-right corner.

steps.title: Tap Privacy.
steps.content: Tap Privacy . This will be next to a padlock icon.

steps.title: Select Private.
steps.content: Select Private . You may have this setting set to Public or Friends . You should see a blue checkmark next to Private . [1] X Research source If prompted, tap Change Anyway . By default, your Venmo transactions will now be set to Private and visible to only you and the recipient/sender.

steps.content: Open the Venmo app. This looks like a white V with a blue background.

steps.title: Tap your profile picture.
steps.content: Tap your profile picture. This will be at the bottom-right corner of the screen.

steps.title: Tap the cog icon.
steps.content: Tap the cog icon. You can find this in the top-right corner.

steps.title: Tap Privacy.
steps.content: Tap Privacy . This will be next to a padlock icon.

steps.title: Tap Friends List.
steps.content: Tap Friends List . You can find this underneath the More header.

steps.title: Tap Private.
steps.content: Tap Private . This will set your friends list as only visible to you. You can also toggle off Appear in other users' friends list for more privacy.

steps.title: Use vague descriptions.
steps.content: Use vague descriptions. Venmo shows who you're paying, if you're friends, and if set to Public, the transaction description. To maintain more security and privacy on Venmo, don't include too much information in the description. You can use unrelated emojis as the description or even acronyms that are enough for you to understand.

steps.title: Routinely revise your friends list.
steps.content: Routinely revise your friends list. You may still have people added to your friends list from years ago. They may no longer be your friend, acquaintance, or in your life. In this case, it's better to remove them to reduce the exposure of your transactions. Venmo has an option to sync your contacts. [2] X Research source If you did this to add friends , consider removing them from your device's contacts, too.

steps.title: Only share your Venmo profile with trusted people.
steps.content: Only share your Venmo profile with trusted people. Venmo has a way to share your profile through QR code , link, or email. When using these methods, make sure you know the person on the other end. Each Venmo account has its own personal QR code. [3] X Research source Try not to screenshot and send this QR code anywhere it can be saved.
